text: today I'm making something super fun
it's peanut butter and chocolate fudge
one layer of peanut butter one layer of
chocolate couldn't be easier
start off by combining a half a cup
sweetened condensed milk and four
tablespoons of butter over a double
boiler
sometimes these easy fudge recipes use
marshmallows as a base today we're using
sweetened condensed milk which is also
done quite frequently to that add 3/4 of
a cup of light brown sugar and just a
pinch of salt when everything is melted
you can remove the bowl from the heat
and stir in your peanut butter here I
have three quarters of a cup of smooth
peanut butter not the health food kind
and one and a half cups of
confectioner's sugar I like to save mine
before I put it in just so it's a little
less lumpy stir until everything comes
together want to make sure everything is
smooth and all the lumps are gone you're
a peanut butter cup fan you're gonna
really really like this transfer to an
8x8 baking dish that's been lettered
lined with parchment and then buttered
again press this layer into the pan nice
and evenly smooth it with an offset
spatula it's more to just get it even
it's not SuperDuper smooth that's okay
now for the chocolate layer this is 9
ounces of bittersweet chocolate that's
been melted to that add the remaining
three-quarters of a cup of sweetened
condensed milk lifts from a 14 ounce can
and then three quarters of a cup of
confectioner's sugar and then you just
stir this together to combine now that
it's fully combined this layer goes on
top of your peanut butter and then
spread evenly over the top same as you
did with the peanut butter get it nice
and smooth there are smooth as you can
just get it into the refrigerator until
it set that should take about two hours
but you can do it overnight for sure or
maybe even two days okay so when it's
chilled you're gonna need to run a
paring knife around the edges to loosen
that butter and all of that fat and
there's congealed so could make it hard
to room
move and then you can lift it out with
the parchment that and then you cut it
into squares I like to use a warm knife
just dip your knife in warm water wipe
it dry that'll just give you nice clean
slices depending on the texture that you
want you can leave it at room
temperature to soften just a little bit
and then you can cut it into little
squares it makes a really fun easy treat
to make great to make with the kids if
you have kids by the way or just as a
really fun indulgence all by yourself
chocolaty goodness
you
